posts.post_content:
When I commented to a friend that I would be pleased to open "almost any rare in this set" at the prerelease, he pointed this out almost right away.
  
   
Admittedly, the only thing that came to mind was that this'd be a way to make [New Frontiers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=New Frontiers) much less enticing for your opponent(s). Making the card a little more one-sided is good... still don't really want to open one of these in a sealed event, though.
  
   
-EDIT-
  
@Wraique: Brutal. =(
  
   
Re: innuendo - well, it's not an "INGUS"... it's an "IGNUS". I didn't make the association until I read agentdynamo's comment. Of course, that might speak more to my naiveté than to the hope that the association was unintentional.

posts.post_content:
While it's flavorful for ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) to hate lands in all forms, it's weird for a card to hose only an ally color. Scars was like that though, see [Koth's Courier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Koth's Courier) and [Glissa's Courier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glissa's Courier). There are one or two in ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) that nab plains but really, this was aimed directly at ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol). More specifically, [Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan), the only reason this saw sideboards besides maybe to make fetches more painful.  
  
@CallMeMerry  
When searching, a player can choose not to pull a card. Rulings on Fertilid:  
*4/1/2008 Although the targeted player doesn't need to find a basic land card if he or she doesn't want to, that player must shuffle his or her library.*  
  
It would be like trying to combo-mill a player by giving them control of [Consecrated Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consecrated Sphinx). Sure, you could try and BS a new player but realistically, it will NOT work.
posts.html:
While it's flavorful for to hate lands in all forms, it's weird for a card to hose only an ally color. Scars was like that though, see Koth's Courier and Glissa's Courier. There are one or two in that nab plains but really, this was aimed directly at . More specifically, Primeval Titan, the only reason this saw sideboards besides maybe to make fetches more painful.

@CallMeMerry
When searching, a player can choose not to pull a card. Rulings on Fertilid:
4/1/2008 Although the targeted player doesn't need to find a basic land card if he or she doesn't want to, that player must shuffle his or her library.

It would be like trying to combo-mill a player by giving them control of Consecrated Sphinx. Sure, you could try and BS a new player but realistically, it will NOT work.

Posted By: flavioal28 (6/16/2012 10:41:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Tunnel Ignus is a bit of a tricky card to work with, since unless you get clever, he'll only pull his weight against decks with [rampant growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rampant growth) style ramp and/or fetchlands. Johnnies looking to build around Tunnel Ignus, though, would do well to consider cards like [Ghost Quarter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghost Quarter)\* and [Veteran Explorer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Veteran Explorer), as well as [New Frontiers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=New Frontiers), and [Collective Journey](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Collective Journey) (which serve as nifty kill cards). You could even throw a playset of Ignuses (Igni?) into a [Warp World](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warp World) deck alongside the usual *Landfall* abusers: According to this guy's rulings, the Ignus will trigger off of ALL the lands the warp gives to your opponent\*\*.  
  
Me, I intend to build a deck with a playset of these and its cousin, [Grinning Ignus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grinning Ignus), with Lorwyn Block elemental support (including the latter Ignus's good buddy [Brighthearth Banneret](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brighthearth Banneret)). A full set of [Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rites)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Tunnel Ignus is a bit of a tricky card to work with, since unless you get clever, he'll only pull his weight against decks with rampant growth style ramp and/or fetchlands. You could even throw a playset of Ignuses (Igni?) into a Warp World deck alongside the usual Landfall abusers: According to this guy's rulings, the Ignus will trigger off of ALL the lands the warp gives to your opponent**.

Me, I intend to build a deck with a playset of these and its cousin, Grinning Ignus, with Lorwyn Block elemental support (including the latter Ignus's good buddy Brighthearth Banneret). A full set of Rites... (see all)

Posted By: flavioal28 (6/16/2012 10:41:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This works extremely well with cards like:  
  
[Thoughtpicker Witch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thoughtpicker Witch)  
[Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress)  
[Despise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Despise)  
[Distress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Distress)  
[Beckon Apparition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Beckon Apparition)  
  
Just control your opponents hand by forcing them to discard or exile any 1, 2, or 3 mana cost cards so that they are forced to lay lands to put down more powerful cards. Then once they get a few more lands out start force discarding or exiling more expensive cards. If you can keep their board clear or mostly clear you can swing with the Ignus and Witch and whatever sacable critters you have to ping them down a notch or two. You can use beckon apparition to permanently remove cards from their graveyard to produce tokens to fuel your Thoughtpicker.
posts.html:
This works extremely well with cards like:

Thoughtpicker Witch
Duress
Despise
Distress
Beckon Apparition

Just control your opponents hand by forcing them to discard or exile any 1, 2, or 3 mana cost cards so that they are forced to lay lands to put down more powerful cards. Then once they get a few more lands out start force discarding or exiling more expensive cards. If you can keep their board clear or mostly clear you can swing with the Ignus and Witch and whatever sacable critters you have to ping them down a notch or two. You can use beckon apparition to permanently remove cards from their graveyard to produce tokens to fuel your Thoughtpicker.
